We use cookies on this site to enhance your user experience. By clicking the Accept All button, you agree to us doing so. You can view our [ privacy policy here ](/privacy-policy/)

Accept All Cookies

Cookie Settings

## Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. [More information](https://cookiepedia.co.uk/giving-consent-to-cookies)

Allow All

###  Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

#### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

# Corporate Governance

[Committee Roles & ResponsibilitiesCommittee Roles & Responsibilities](#p-697) [View our Annual General MeetingsAnnual General Meetings](#p-13806) [Diversity & InclusionDiversity & Inclusion](#p-10780) [Policies & StatementsPolicies & Statements](#p-13952)

## Committees

## **Audit Committee**

The Audit Committee determines and examines any matters relating to the financial affairs of the Group including the terms of engagement of the Group’s auditors and, in consultation with the auditors, the scope of the audit. In addition, it considers the financial performance, position and prospects of the Group and ensures they are properly monitored and reported on. The Audit Committee meets not less than twice in each financial year and has unrestricted access to the Group’s auditors.

[Audit Committee Terms of Reference](https://www.alphagroup.com/download/13763/?tmstv=1713942786)

The Audit Committee has three members, both of whom are independent, non-executive directors and have recent and relevant financial experience. The current members of the committee are Vijay Thakrar (Chair), Clive Kahn, and Jayne-Anne Gadhia. View their bios below.

[Vijay Thakrar (Chair)](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/vijay-thakrar/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-699) [Jayn-Anne Gadhia](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/dame-jayne-anne-gadhia/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-699) [Clive Kahn](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/clive-kahn/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-699)

## **Remuneration Committee**

The Remuneration Committee reviews the performance of the Executive Directors and sets their remuneration, determines the payment of bonuses to the Executive Directors and considers the Group’s bonus and incentive arrangements for employees. In exercising this role, members of this committee have regard to the recommendations put forward in the Corporate Governance Code. The Remuneration Committee meets not less than twice a year and at such other times as the chairman of the committee requires.

[Remuneration Committee Terms of Reference](https://www.alphagroup.com/download/13771/?tmstv=1713942786)

The Remuneration Committee has three members, both of whom are independent, non-executive directors. The current members of the committee are Vijay Thakrar (chair), Clive Kahn, and Jayne-Anne Gadhia.

[Vijay Thakrar](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/vijay-thakrar/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-702)[ (Chair) ](https://www.alphagroup.com/?post_type=person&p=1067#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-702)[Clive Kahn](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/clive-kahn/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-702) [Jayne-Anne Gadhia](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/dame-jayne-anne-gadhia/?group=6#/investors/the-board/#post-13820#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-702)

## **Nomination Committee**

The Nominations Committee reviews and recommends nominees as new Directors to the Board. The Nominations Committee meets not less than once a year and at such other times as the chairman of the committee requires.

[Nomination Committee Terms of Reference](https://www.alphagroup.com/download/13779/?tmstv=1713942854)

The nomination committee is chaired by Jayne-Anne Gadhia. It’s other member is Vijay Thakrar.

[Jayne-Anne Gadhia (Chair)](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/dame-jayne-anne-gadhia/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-706) [Vijay Thakrar](https://www.alphagroup.com/person/vijay-thakrar/#/investors/corporate-governance/#p-706)

## Annual General Meetings

[Annual General Meeting Notice 2024](https://www.alphagroup.com/download/13666/?tmstv=1713945126) (01/05/2023)

## Diversity & Inclusion

We are committed to ensuring Alpha is a diverse and inclusive place to work. We operate a true meritocracy, recruiting and promoting people based on their attitude, skills, and experience. We do not discriminate between employees or prospective employees on the grounds of age, race, disability, religion, gender, education, or any other criteria. Fundamentally, we believe that the more diverse a business is, the greater its potential performance. The following data shows the Group’s gender and ethnicity breakdown.

### % Female (as at 12/2022)

  * Board: **17%**
  * Senior Management: **35%**
  * Group Colleagues: **32%**



### Ethnicity (as at 04/2023)

  * White British & White Other: **84.5%**
  * Ethnic: **15.5%**

Cookie Settings

## Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. [More information](https://cookiepedia.co.uk/giving-consent-to-cookies)

Allow All

###  Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

#### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-5-3000x1901.jpg)![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-Mobile-1500x3499.jpg)

# Our past performance is the result of being relentlessly focused on the future.

[Read more about our Investment CaseRead more](#)

## Alpha is a high-tech, high-touch provider of financial solutions, dedicated to corporates and institutions operating internationally.

Working with circa 1,000 clients across 50+ countries, we blend deep expertise with cutting-edge technologies to provide an enhanced alternative to traditional banking services, with solutions covering: FX risk management, global accounts, mass payments, fund finance and cash management.

Key to our success is our team – over 480 people based across ten global offices, brought together by a high-performance culture and a partnership structure that empowers them to act as owners of our business.

Despite being an established FTSE 250 business listed on the London Stock Exchange, we remain relentlessly focused on maintaining the same level of operational agility and client focus we had when we first started in 2009. This dynamic, combined with the passion of our people, has enabled us to make a substantial and enduring difference to our clients, and deliver a growth story to match.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Alpha-Home-We-are-high-tech-and-high-touch.jpg)

# We’re half-human, half-digital.

Boston Consulting Group wrote that “for a company to achieve its full potential, technology must be combined with the flexibility, adaptability and comprehensive experience of humans.” It’s a view we’ve shared since inception, and by blending human capabilities with new technologies, we continue to amplify innovation, service levels, efficiency, growth, and resilience.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investors-Diversified-1.jpg)

# We’re diversified.

We provide an array of solutions across a variety of sectors and geographies, with clients in over 50 countries and 30 sectors. As a result, we’ve grown strongly and profitably every year since inception, even in the most challenging macro-environments.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investment-Case-Well-Capitalised.jpg)![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investment-Case-Well-Capitalised-Mobile-1500x1859.jpg)

# We’re well–capitalised.

Profitable revenue growth and strong cash conversion means we have a healthy and growing cash position. This enables us to capitalise on future investment opportunities and provide more attractive terms versus our competitors, without the need for further external investment.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-Collectively-Owned-1.jpg)![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-Collectively-Owned-Mobile.jpg)

# We’re collectively-owned.

Our unique partnership structure means that everyone that works at Alpha has the opportunity to own equity in the business, with circa 100 employees already shareholders. This collective ownership has been key to creating an intrapreneurial, high-performance environment that drives our unique growth story.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-David-and-Goliath-5.jpg)![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-David-and-Goliath-Mobile-1500x1720.jpg)

# We’re both David and Goliath.

Despite being an established FTSE 250 business, we remain relentlessly focused on retaining the same levels of operational agility and client-centricity we had when we first started in 2009. This dynamic of being _both_ David and Goliath is key to maintaining an effective and scalable business model and outperforming our competition.

![](https://www.alphagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Alpha-Investors-Investment-Case-Getting-Started-2.jpg)

# And we’re just getting started…

We estimate that we have captured less than 1% of our addressable market, with a runway that extends across 50 countries (and growing) as we expand into new geographies and products.

# Remaining both David _and_ Goliath.

[Read more about Our StrategyRead more](#)

## Overcoming the Growth Paradox.

As a business grows, so does the size and strength of its capabilities. The more effectively it can leverage these capabilities, the faster it should grow. However, this becomes harder the larger it becomes…

In our experience, successful start-ups grow quickly for three key reasons: they have strong teams with strong cultures; they move fast; and they have strong relationships with their clients and understand what’s important to them. Established businesses which start to slow down, do so for the same reasons but in reverse. As they scale they: compromise on their people and culture; become mired in legacy systems and bureaucratic processes; and lose touch with what’s important to their clients.

**It is our belief that a business that can grow its capabilities without diluting the ‘start-up DNA’ that made it successful in the first place, is the one that is best positioned for long-term sustainable growth. It is for these reasons we remain relentlessly focused on being both ‘David _and_ Goliath’ as we grow.**

### **Our start-up DNA…**

## **Cultural Density**

**Providing an exceptional community full of opportunity, that inspires our team to expel discretionary energy and go further than our peers.**

## **Operational Agility**

**Reducing complexity and complacency as we scale to provide a low friction and efficient experience for our clients and team.**

## **Client Centricity**

**Scaling a high-performing yet client-centric sales team that puts our clients’ needs first whilst seeking to better understand them.**

### **+ Growing Capabilities**

## Net Treasury Income – Client Funds

Whilst the increased interest stream from client balances is a positive boost for the Group and a natural by-product of our increasingly diversified product offering, we are mindful that aspects of its dynamics are driven by macroeconomics beyond our control. We have therefore chosen to recognise interest income on client cash balances as ‘Net Treasury Income – Client Funds’, not revenue. We share the blended average client balances and interest rates through our website on a quarterly basis, in order to provide a mechanism for stakeholders to model this interest income themselves.

**Q3 2024**

  * Blended average balance: £2.2bn
  * Blended average interest rate: 3.8%



**Q2 2024**

  * Blended average balance: £2.1bn
  * Blended average interest rate: 3.9%



**Q1 2024**

  * Blended average balance: £2.0bn
  * Blended average interest rate: 4.0%



**Q4 2023**

  * Blended average balance: £2.1bn
  * Blended average interest rate: 3.8%

  * Blended average balance: £1.9bn

## Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. ###  Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

#### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.
